places.name: Zócalo de Puebla
places.address: Av. Don Juan de Palafox y Mendoza, Centro, 72000 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: The main square of Puebla, surrounded by colonial buildings, restaurants, and cultural attractions. Ideal for a stroll and people-watching.

places.name: Catedral de Puebla
places.address: C. 16 de Septiembre s/n, Centro, 72000 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: A stunning Baroque-style cathedral with the tallest towers in Mexico. A masterpiece of religious architecture.

places.name: Museo Amparo
places.description: A modern museum showcasing pre-Hispanic, colonial, and contemporary art in a beautifully restored building.

places.name: Estrella de Puebla
places.address: Osa Mayor 2520, Reserva Territorial Atlixcayotl, 72830 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: A giant Ferris wheel offering panoramic views of the city and the volcanoes on clear days.

places.name: Africam Safari
places.address: Km 16.5 Carretera al Oasis Valsequillo, 72960 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: A safari-style zoo where animals roam freely in natural habitats. Ideal for families and wildlife enthusiasts.

places.name: Fuerte de Loreto
places.address: Calz. de los Fuertes s/n, Centro, 72290 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: A historical fort where the Battle of Puebla took place on May 5, 1862. Now a museum with artifacts and exhibits.

places.name: Callejón de los Sapos
places.description: A colorful alley famous for its antiques market and vibrant colonial architecture. Great for photos and local shopping.

places.name: Capilla del Rosario
places.address: Av. 5 de Mayo 407, Centro, 72000 Puebla, Pue.
places.description: One of the most ornate Baroque chapels in Latin America, located inside the Templo de Santo Domingo.
